item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, February 28, 2025 at 2:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. I found 1000 GitHub repos with malware. Can we get them deleted? (220 points | 78 comments)
2. WASM Wayland Web (WWW) (208 points | 140 comments)
3. Netboot Windows 11 with iSCSI and iPXE (46 points | 20 comments)
4. GPT-4.5 (1002 points | 824 comments)
5. Gleam, Coming from Erlang (71 points | 16 comments)
6. macOS Tips and Tricks (2022) (481 points | 242 comments)
7. Mozilla deletes promise to never sell Firefox data (634 points | 257 comments)
8. Boris Spassky: 1937–2025 (102 points | 10 comments)
9. Waterfox: Fast and Private Web Browser (8 points | 1 comment)
10. Openlayer (YC S21) is hiring a senior back end engineer ( | hide)
11. Electric Propulsion Magnets Ready for Space Tests (19 points | 15 comments)
12. AMD RDNA 4 – AMD Radeon RX 9000 Series Graphics Cards (31 points | 26 comments)
13. Type 1 diabetes reversed by new cell transplantation technique (318 points | 51 comments)
14. Calendar.txt (102 points | 50 comments)
15. SEC Declares Memecoins Are Not Subject to Oversight (47 points | 37 comments)
16. Spotify's Beta Used 'Pirate' MP3 Files, Some from Pirate Bay (236 points | 159 comments)
17. Turning a Bluetooth device into an Apple AirTag without root privileges (456 points | 76 comments)
18. Why and How I use "Org Mode" for my writing and more (94 points | 24 comments)
19. Exploring UK Environment Agency Data with DuckDB and Rill (3 points | discuss)
20. Fire-Flyer File System from DeepSeek (224 points | 43 comments)
21. Microsoft begins turning off uBlock Origin and other extensions in Edge (388 points | 226 comments)
22. Narrative and the Structure of Art (4 points | discuss)
23. Markov Chains Explained Visually (2014) (166 points | 16 comments)
24. EA Open Sources Command and Conquer: Red Alert, along with other games (1016 points | 265 comments)
25. Thermoelectric Solar Panel (21 points | 5 comments)
26. Welcome to Ladybird, a truly independent web browser (721 points | 251 comments)
27. World-first experimental cancer treatment paves way for clinical trial (154 points | 54 comments)
28. WebShield – A new wide-spectrum content blocker for Safari (9 points | discuss)
29. IBM completes acquisition of HashiCorp (411 points | 295 comments)
30. Putting Andrew Ng's OCR models to the test (82 points | 44 comments)
